review.title: Convergence analysis of the information matrix in Gaussian belief propagation
review.abstract: Gaussian belief propagation (BP) has been widely used for distributed estimation in large-scale networks such as the smart grid, communication networks, and social networks, where local measurements/observations are scattered over a wide geographical area. However, the convergence of Gaus- sian BP is still an open issue. In this paper, we consider the convergence of Gaussian BP, focusing in particular on the convergence of the information matrix. We show analytically that the exchanged message information matrix converges for arbitrary positive semidefinite initial value, and its dis- tance to the unique positive definite limit matrix decreases exponentially fast.

sections.heading: 4. CONCLUSION
sections.text: In this paper, the convergence of the Gaussian Propagation of Faith (BP) exchanged message matrix for the distributed estimate was established. We have analytically shown that the information matrix converges at any positive semidefinitive baseline to a uniquely positive definitive matrix at geometric rate. Convergence guaranteed property and fast convergence rate of the message information matrix pave the way for the convergence analysis of the Gaussian BP message vector.
